answers.answer: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmedhealth/PMH0001898/It's to make sure you and the baby are in good health. There's a few risks if you have it and don't take care of yourself.
I'm surprised how many people are told to fast because I've been allowed to eat prior to my test with each of my 3 pregnancies. I was told if I had to do the 3 hour test then I'd have to fast.

I have no idea but this is my first baby and i just dont think its a big deal especially since my blood pressure keeps going up and down im sure im going to have to be induced anyhow. Every appt im told my babys healthy and shes very active. Plus i eat very well im just overweight.

question: Ok so i know that gestational diabetes is a form of diabetes some women develope during pregnancy. Soo my doctor gave me a lab requisition to have this test done last month but i cannot fast. I try but in the middle of the night i get so hungry. What is the importance of getting my blood drawn for this?!!
title: Diabetes and Pregnancy
